PerformanceEntry.summary: The PerformanceEntry object encapsulates a single performance metric that is part of the browser's performance timeline.

remarks.para: The Performance API offers built-in metrics which are specialized subclasses of PerformanceEntry. This includes entries for resource loading, event timing, and more.
A performance entry can also be created by calling the or methods at an explicit point in an application. This allows you to add your own metrics to the performance timeline.
The PerformanceEntry instances will always be one of the following subclasses:

PerformanceEntryStartTime.summary: The read-only startTime property returns the first {{domxref("DOMHighResTimeStamp","timestamp", "", "no-code")}} recorded for this . The meaning of this property depends on the value of this entry's .
PerformanceEntryStartTime.value:
A representing the first timestamp when the
was created.The meaning of this property depends on the value of this performance entry's :

PerformanceEntryDuration.summary: The read-only duration property returns a {{domxref("DOMHighResTimeStamp","timestamp", "", "no-code")}} that is the duration of the {{domxref("PerformanceEntry","performance entry", "", "no-code")}}. The meaning of this property depends on the value of this entry's .
PerformanceEntryDuration.value: A representing the duration of the {{domxref("PerformanceEntry","performance entry", "", "no-code")}}. If the duration concept doesn't apply for a particular performance metric, a duration of 0 is returned.The meaning of this property depends on the value of this performance entry's :For the following entry types, duration is not applicable, and in this case the value is always 0:

PerformanceEntryEntryType.summary: The read-only entryType property returns a string representing the type of performance metric that this entry represents.

remarks.para: All supported entryTypes are available using the static property .

PerformanceEntryEntryType.value: A string. The return value depends on the subtype of the PerformanceEntry object. Some subtypes have more than one entryType.

PerformanceEntryName.summary: The read-only name property of the interface is a string representing the name for a performance entry. It acts as an identifier, but it does not have to be unique. The value depends on the subclass.
PerformanceEntryName.value: A string. The value depends on the subclass of the PerformanceEntry object as shown by the table below.

PerformanceEntryToJSON.summary: The toJSON() method is a {{Glossary("Serialization","serializer")}}; it returns a JSON representation of the object.
PerformanceEntryToJSON.returns: A {{jsxref("JSON")}} object that is the serialization of the object.
